alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Henry; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:19AM EDT until April 01 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR NORTHERN DEFIANCE...NORTHWESTERN HENRY...WILLIAMS AND FULTON COUNTIES... At 1219 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Morenci to near Archbold, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bryan, Wauseon, Archbold, Montpelier, Swanton, Delta, Edgerton, West Unity, Stryker, Fayette, Edon, Holiday City, West Jefferson, Pulaski, Farmer, Metamora, Lyons, Blakeslee, Evansport and Oakshade. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 48. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northeastern Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
